column4: so, it seems I can't successfully run or install any kind of linux on this computer, while windows works fine.
well, I guess since linux tries very hard not to run, I'll just have to use windows
there is no windows currently on the computer
but it ran win7 for months before
I've tried ubuntu 12, 10, mint, fedora, debian...
mint I could actually get to launch in text mode, and start X from there, then proceed to install it, but the installed one wont even launch into text mode...
it's a little frustrating, seeing how all the versions I've tried work flawlessly on my main computer
what can you tell us about the specs?  Have you some older distros?  old slack, puppy, or even an archaic debian or ubuntu ?
Hmm.  it should just work.  try editing the command line and removing quiet splash and see if it hangs up on any particular step to isolate the problem.
I'm thinking either one small piece of bad hardware, or an incompatible setting somewhere that windows either doesn't trip (hardware) or isn't incompatible with (setting)
could be 64 bit is disabled.  Make sure it's enabled and try a 32 bit OS.
okay it seems stuck now. last line was "[TTM] Zone kernel: Avilable graphics memory: 431040 kiB."
32 or 64 bit this time, and what boot-time options?

I'm sorry, but I'm out of ideas here.  Best I can suggest is to keep trying and watch the boot output for something useful.  there might be something in the acpi and apic settings but I don't remember them off the top of my head.
and if you can't figure it out, try again when there are more people active.  they're generally pretty helpful.  Or the forums.
I had the same problem with an old win 95 compaq computer.  never did figure it out.  settled for partial data recovery and junked it.
